image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn admits covering up the deaths of two campers and disposing of their bodies, his lawyer says, but insists he is innocent of murder.

title.children: 'Two accidental deaths': Lawyers for ex-pilot Greg Lynn outline defence case in camper murder trial

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers will hand down his third federal budget tonight, but the government has been steadily drip-feeding key announcements for weeks. Here's everything we already know about what's inside.

title.children: What's in the budget? Here's every announcement that you'll hear about later today

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers during Question Time.

props.synopsis: Question Time is getting underway ahead of Treasurer Jim Chalmers handing down the 2024 federal budget. Follow live.

title.children: Finance minister and shadow treasurer join Afternoon Briefing ahead of budget announcement

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Cost-of-living help 'the number one issue' for Australians
When will it be time for 'slash and burn austerity'?
Finance minister: 'The pressures on the budget continue to intensify'

image.altText: People walk across the street towards Flinders Street Station.

props.synopsis: Melbourne City Council will look for grants and donations to make more than a dozen of its promised projects a reality.

title.children: Flagship Melbourne council projects left without ongoing funding in latest council budget

image.altText: A large sign that says 'you are now entering free gaza encampment' with a few tents in the background and a Palestine flag.

props.synopsis: Tensions over pro-Palestinian encampments and protests at Australian universities are in the spotlight, with one Melbourne university ordering participants to dismantle their camp, and the prime minister weighing in on a demonstration at another.

title.children: Students ordered to dismantle pro-Palestinian encampment as tensions flare over university protests

image.altText: David speaks into a microphone as supporters' signs wave behind him and a guy holds a guitar.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride is jailed for unlawfully leaking classified documents to journalists after last year pleading guilty to stealing and sharing secret military information.

title.children: Former military lawyer David McBride jailed for sharing classified information with journalists

image.altText: A composite image of David Shoebridge, James Paterson and Peter Khalil.

props.synopsis: Chinese police hunting international corruption targets were allowed into Australia by the federal police and subsequently escorted a woman back to China for trial, in a major breach of Chinese-Australian police protocols.

title.children: 'Extrajudicial extradition': MPs alarmed about Chinese police escorting Australian resident to China for trial

image.altText: A long dragon.

props.synopsis: Police release images of two suspects after "deliberate" damage to historical and culturally significant artefacts at the Golden Dragon Museum and the Great Stupa of Universal Compassion in Bendigo earlier this month.

title.children: 'Mindless' vandals damage century-old Loong dragon, sacred Great Stupa statues

image.altText: Jim Chalmers during Labor caucus meeting__bfadb08a4ff478a0254b937808092f54

props.synopsis: The federal budget will deliver a $9.3 billion surplus for the current financial year, but the next three will each have higher deficits than the government had expected as recently as December.

title.children: Australia is set for a $9.3 billion surplus, but deficits for next three financial years

image.altText: Two  women walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters, with the building's name prominent in the background.

props.synopsis: Federal budgets have always been a juggling act, but inflation's belated second wind and a weakening economy mean the treasurer must somehow encourage growth without making inflation any worse.

title.children: Competing interests mean this year's budget is the most confusing in years

image.altText: plane on tarmac with man walking down

props.synopsis: Bonza workers are told they will remain stood down for at least another two weeks, as administrators scramble to find investors to support the troubled airline.

title.children: 'Grim' mood among Bonza staff facing two months without pay

image.altText: A young man with brown hair speaks to the media in front of a sponsorship sign

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs rookie Aiden O'Driscoll is forced to retire on medical advice after suffering a significant head injury during a pre-season training session.

title.children: Six months after being touted 'the best athlete in the pool', this AFL draftee has been forced to retire without playing a game

image.altText: A close up of 2024-25 federal budet papers stacked on a crate, with a printmaker in the background

props.synopsis: The release of the budget will inevitably involve a lot of political talk, but the government's plan will impact your financial situation in one way or another, so it's quite important. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: What to expect from tonight's budget speech and where to watch it

image.altText: Rachel (fair right) pictured with two of her daughters, wearing white and orange dresses, hugging each other.

props.synopsis: As the cost-of-living crisis worsens, the ABC spoke to families and students who say they're relying on savings tip-offs online, discount stores, and food banks to get by.

title.children: Rachel 'hit the jackpot' when she found meat for 74 cents. She posted the bargain online to help others deal with rising costs

image.altText: A stylised image of a partially obscured man's face with scrabble-style tiles flying towards him

props.synopsis: The ABC has identified James Raptis, a lawyer at Australian Community Media, as being linked to a series of websites that were stealing – and mangling – stories from other sites.

title.children: We asked this Australian lawyer if he was behind a 'parasitic' content farm. Hours later it was all taken down

image.altText: Prince Harry wearing a suit and sunglasses leans in to Meghan Markle wearing sunglasses and a yellow dress.

props.synopsis: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's 72-hour visit to Nigeria has attracted a level of publicity Buckingham Palace has been sorely lacking of late. Is it a reminder of the "Harry-shaped hole in the monarchy?"

title.children: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Nigerian tour is a reminder of what might have been

image.altText: Red and yellow lights glowing above land with a plane wing in view

props.synopsis: While the weekend's incredible auroral display might be over, the Sun's antics may still be ramping up over the next few months. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Researchers believe last weekend's display might not be the only auroras we see this year

image.altText: A man in traditional dress.

props.synopsis: Canadian company Agnico Eagle has signed an agreement with traditional owner group Djaara to compensate First Nations people for gold mined at the Central Victorian-based Fosterville Gold Mine.

title.children: Gold mining company to share revenue with traditional owners in 'historic' deal

image.altText: A young, mustashioed man in a dark cap and hoodie stands with his arms folded in front of a fire truck.

props.synopsis: The incident occurred during a union push for more funding to help firefighters maintain Victoria's aging fleet.

title.children: Firies fuming after truck breakdown leads to lengthy ride in a taxi

image.altText: A young white woman with long fair hair standing in a field. She is wearing a green cardigan

props.synopsis: Dozens of patients have contacted the ABC, reporting alarming side effects including vomiting blood and permanent tingling in their fingers after taking replica weight loss drugs.

title.children: Ilisa was vomiting blood after injecting replica Ozempic. The pharmacy kept ringing to sell her more

image.altText: A child scrolls through a tablet.

props.synopsis: The timing of South Australia's announcement of a social media ban suggests that the federal government's plan to introduce age verification for porn could easily be expanded — and is it any surprise?

title.children: First porn, then social media? How age verification tech could cross over

image.altText: A graphic showing a woman smiling in a selfie embeded on top of a photo of the front of a house with a police officer.

props.synopsis: A teenager gave a thumbs up before entering a family's home on Boxing Day. What followed destroyed a father and children, who could no longer sleep alone.

title.children: A family was asleep on Boxing Day when a teen on a Christmas bender changed everything

image.altText: This photograph shows a view of burnt cars and a burnt Renault car shop amid protests in New Caledonia.

props.synopsis: Overnight riots in the South Pacific French territory saw vehicles torched and roads blocked in the wake of proposed constitutional reforms.

title.children: New Caledonia imposes curfew following fiery overnight riots

image.altText: Célia Gery talks to her team car when it crashes into back of Amandine Muller

props.synopsis: The shocking moment a car crashed into the back of the leader of an under-19 cycling race in France was captured on TV.

title.children: 'A car can be a weapon': The horrifying moment car crashes into leaders of cycling race

image.altText: Explosions go off on a damaged section of bridge, which is leaning against a damaged cargo ship

props.synopsis: The controlled demolition marks a major step in freeing the container ship Dali, which has been stuck amid the wreckage since it lost power and crashed into one of the bridge's support columns shortly after leaving Baltimore on March 26.

title.children: 'Surgical' demolition brings down largest remaining section of Baltimore bridge

image.altText: Tasmanian Catholic Archbishop Julian Porteous

props.synopsis: A letter to the parents of Catholic school students in Tasmania detailing a list of grievances by the archbishop, including that the church "cannot stand as we experience our freedoms being taken from us", is criticised by politicians and LGBTIQA+ advocates.

title.children: 'Nothing short of hateful': Letter by Catholic Archbishop to student parents criticised

image.altText: A composite image of John Farnham on the left from a Countdown performance. A teenager girl in a blonde wig on the right singing

props.synopsis: While some schools might attempt a classic musical like Grease, this one has looked to Australian music royalty and, in the process, put on the show of a lifetime.

title.children: Belting out John Farnham classics and travelling through time — this musical is like no other

image.altText: Escondida copper mine in Chile, a BHP and Rio Tinto joint venture

props.synopsis:
Mega-miner BHP is not getting bigger today, as the board of Anglo American have rejected a second takeover bid.

The ASX 200 has opened slightly lower as the market awaits the full detail of the federal budget. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: BHP knocked back again in takeover saga, ASX opens slightly lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Subsidies are not inflation magic' and rates will stay higher for longer: HSBC
Dating App Bumble removes ads 'promoting' sex

image.altText: A man wearing glasses sits in a darkened room

props.synopsis: A Chinese spy who is now on Australian soil has revealed his incredible story to Four Corners.

title.children: Eric landed in Australia and walked into the ASIO headquarters. 'I'm a Chinese spy,' he declared

image.altText: Fire flashes from the canon of a tank

props.synopsis: US national security adviser Jake Sullivan says it is "a total outrage" that Israeli citizens have attacked aid bound for Gaza.

title.children: Most intense fighting for weeks rages in Gaza's north and south

image.altText: Close up of pig snout

props.synopsis: Although the first person to receive a genetically-modified pig kidney died after two months, researchers are still hopeful the animals will play a major role in future organ donation.

title.children: Are pigs the answer to organ donation shortages? How porcine parts made their way into humans

image.altText: Image of two Shih Tzu dogs walking on artificial turf with a pair of legs next to them.

props.synopsis: From tiny terriers to towering Great Danes, the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show in the United States shows off all types of breeds and dedicated owners keen to grab the prized title of top dog.

title.children: 'A dream come true': Owners show off their trusted pooches during the Westminster dog show

image.altText: Renee is looking at the camera while steaming a colourful blue and orange dress.

props.synopsis: Blending traditional Indigenous techniques with cutting-edge production methods, Renee Henderson creates stunning designs inspired by Aboriginal art and culture.

title.children: Renee is only 24, but her fashion designs are about to hit the runway for the third time
